About me

I am a software developer with over 20 years of experience in Pharo / Smalltalk, Java, C, and other languages. I also have a few years of experience in research and teaching at the university level.

I currently work as a software engineer for the Pharo Consortium, focused on Bloc and its associated graphics library ecosystem.

During 2018-21, I did research and develop software with focus on data visualization with Alexandre Bergel. This happened, first, in the context of a postdoc position at Computer Science Department (DCC) of the University of Chile (Faculty of Engineering), and later as an employee of Object Profile.

During 2016-18, I worked as a teacher at University of Quilmes, and also as developer of web applications.

In 2015, I've got a Ph.D. at University of Lille under the supervision of Stéphane Ducasse and Damien Cassou. I was part of RMoD research group at Inria. In my thesis I've worked in software evolution, first-class code changes, code integration activities, and untangling code changes.

I did my studies in computer science at the Computer Department of the University of Buenos Aires, where I received my degree in Computer Sciences. In my master thesis, I worked in Fuel, an object serialization framework for Pharo, which has been adopted by the community. My supervisors were Hernán Wilkinson, Carlos E. Ferro, and Stéphane Ducasse.

Simultaneously with my university career, I worked as a programmer for software companies such as Hexacta.
